intro: Stypostylis vernus, commonly known as the common stypostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in coastal areas and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Stypostylis vernus is an herbaceous perennial that is well adapted to the harsh conditions of its natural habitat.
